intro: Meibomia velutina, commonly known as the velvet meibomia, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and climbers. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a velvety texture, giving it its common name. Meibomia velutina is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
